turns.text: Okay How do you get your news mostly
turns.label: o

turns.text: -- and just fall off on the articles that I like
Uh also since my wife likes to watch sometimes uh ju- having - just being there I get uh you know I have to watch the news late at night --

turns.text: Well I can hardly wait for my morning paper to come
turns.label: sd

turns.text: So thats the first thing I want is the headlines Its really funny because because uh uh my sister grabs the sports and I grab the headlines
turns.label: sd

turns.text: But uh and then when five oclock comes around I just want to get in the house and turn the on to watch the news
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Uh I do have my radio going most of the day though so about every hour it breaks in and gives me news too you know

But as far as the actual news I get that from from the - can you hold on just for second

turns.label: b

turns.text: And uh you know also late at night you know I dont wa- like watching the news late at night but my wife is usually up then and so --

I uh - but you know I I wish I had uh more news on things like that I consider long range Things like science and medicine --

-- uh Im more I guess Im more into science and science fiction and uh theres you know - not that the news is science fiction but uh uh Im more interested in that Things like uh is NASA ready for another space shot Uh you know how hot are they on the trail of cure for such and such cancer --

turns.text: Just uh especially the weather I like that
Yeah Georgia here theyre usually wrong too We have weird weather systems

turns.text: uh-huh But uh like I say as far as as actually listening to the news its mostly five oclock to six thirty Uh that seems like long time for news but thats how long it is

Yeah right Once you get to work I wouldnt either huh-uh
